Blog.post: urlLink Double Printing. These are obviously 2 different negatives. I took the picture of the tree by the other one (by the gas station), and the water rings by the grocery store. I was the first of all the classes to attempt this project, and it worked on my first try. urlLink
urlLink Palm tree at sunset in Rosarito. It looks like a postcard image. urlLink
urlLink Surf at sunset. urlLink
urlLink This was taken on the beach at sunset by the broken pier in Rosarito. urlLink
urlLink I like this shot a lot. I like how the water looks very blue and the sky has the orange and yellow. urlLink
urlLink This is the bench my grandma like to sit and read at when she's down at her house in Rosarito. urlLink
urlLink This one reminds me of the Pirates of the Caribbeann. It's a pic of Britt with her hand on her rifle when we were in Mexico. urlLink
urlLink Telephone wire crossing outside my door urlLink
urlLink Trees by my house at sunset. So pretty. urlLink
urlLink Clouds and tree in Colorado urlLink
urlLink Santa Sophia church at sunset. urlLink
urlLink This is one of the first projects I got in my photo class. It was really easy; just bring in some things, put them on the photo paper and turn on the enlarger. urlLink

urlLink Kid on Merry-Go-Round. I was in Balboa Park when I came to the carousel. I was going to take a picture of just the horse, but then the kid got on...so I took the picture of him too. I got this into 2 art shows; one at my school and one at the mall...It didn't win anything, but it was there. I thought that was pretty cool. urlLink
urlLink I took this picture last year when my friend, Suzy, and I were walking around school taking dumb pictures. It was a bad picture of a duddy flower, but it looks cool solarized. urlLink
urlLink No, this is NOT an evil moose-man. This is a picture of my cat, Pooch cleaning himself. Can you see it? urlLink

urlLink This picture doesn't look quite right to me, something about the way the light was shining on the lilly pads, or the focusing. I like it that way though... I'm not sure why. This was taken by the botanical gardens in Balboa Park. urlLink
urlLink I took this for a project in my photo class. 2 old men feeding pidgeons in Balboa Park. urlLink
urlLink I took this on my walk home by a gas station. urlLink
urlLink This picture was also taken in Seaport Village. urlLink
urlLink This picture was taken in Seaport Village. They're just some ducks takin' a bath. urlLink
urlLink And one more of those urlLink
urlLink And another. urlLink

urlLink Here's another one of those cloud shots I took in Mexico that I never posted. It was very difficult choosing a picture to put up for this challenge because I do like taking pictures of clouds so I have quite a few. I'm not sure if this is my favorite, but it shows the clouds and the sunbeams and the focus is on the water so...I dunno, I just like it. urlLink
urlLink A picture of the clouds I took out of the window without looking when we were on the freeway. urlLink
urlLink And another out of the car window, not on the freeway this time though. urlLink
urlLink And another of that urlLink
urlLink My friend, Brittany, and her reflection. urlLink
urlLink Leaves. Kinda looks like some grapes to me. urlLink
urlLink The plants at the top of that fence urlLink
urlLink And another urlLink
urlLink This is a view of some leaves through the fence at my friend's house. urlLink

urlLink Here's one of just the petal I took a bit ago. It was the only thing I could think up for this week's challenge. I know a lot of people were doing flowers and whatnot, but.....too bad, this is my picture and I like it. So...yeah. The petal does look quite perfect to me. urlLink
urlLink Another... urlLink
urlLink The stupid camera kept focusing on the wood behind the flower...I couldn't get it to stop urlLink
urlLink Another diving shot. Tanya this time. urlLink
urlLink View of the trees by the pool urlLink
urlLink The water at the pool I was swimming @ yesterday. urlLink
urlLink Here's the same one of Pooch in the mirror,just more pretty. : ) urlLink
urlLink The sun and clouds above the pool urlLink
urlLink I think this picture diplays fashion because they are my new sunglasses I got at Pacific Eyes and T's and one place fashion still counts is at the pool. urlLink
urlLink Another short through my sunglasses, but at the pool this time urlLink
urlLink My friend, Brittany going under urlLink
urlLink Another diving shot urlLink
urlLink Rion diving into the pool urlLink
urlLink Water in the pool urlLink
urlLink Pole down to the water urlLink
urlLink Here's Pooch looking at himself in the mirror urlLink
urlLink Shady, my FAT cat, drinking out of the bathroom sink. urlLink
urlLink I got 2 this time!! urlLink
urlLink And another...attempting to get some suga'! urlLink
urlLink Yet another of the bird urlLink
urlLink Here's another one with the backyard view through my sunglasses. It wasn't originally black and white, but it looks better that way. urlLink
urlLink I've been a little obsessed with getting a good shot of the hummingbird. Clearly this isn't it, but it's hard! urlLink
urlLink This is a picture of the hummingbird I got right as he was flying away. This shot looks like a journey for me because the bird is so little and the sky around him seems limitless. urlLink
urlLink Here's another picture of him. It's kinda grainy because I was using the optical and digital zoom on my camera. urlLink

urlLink The hummingbird that lives in my backyard. It was hard to get him to stay there becuase he kept flying away when I came near him...or when he chased away another hummingbird trying to get some food. urlLink
urlLink This is the view of the fence in my backyard through my sunglasses on the table. urlLink
urlLink These are some weird flowers on the side of the road I took a picture of when I was walking home today. urlLink
urlLink This is the church that I see on my way home from school. Santa Sophia church. It's not a great shot, but I posted it anyway, I guess. urlLink

urlLink I chose this picture for this week's challenge " Ocean " because...it's of the ocean, and it's my favorite picture of the ocean I have taken. It looks to me, though, like one of those pictures with writing about Jesus or writing from the Bible on it... This picture was taken in Rosarito, Mexico around sunset. urlLink
urlLink I posted some pictures of the rose before...down the page more. This one was the clearest one but I never posted it because of the ugly petal.... urlLink
urlLink A face only his mother could love urlLink
urlLink And it's gone.... urlLink
urlLink Ending of the sunset from the Carl's Jr parking lot urlLink
urlLink And yet one more. urlLink
urlLink And another urlLink
urlLink Another of that urlLink
urlLink Finally got a good view, but sunset's almost over. urlLink
urlLink Another tree urlLink
urlLink Caught behind come trees. urlLink
urlLink Trying to find a better view of the sunset... urlLink

urlLink This is a picture I took one day while leaving my house to drive around to get good pictures of the sunset, this was my favorite one of about 30 (good) shots I took that night. Those little white dots are cars' headlights on the freeway. urlLink
urlLink The sky at another sunset from my house, powerlines in the corner. urlLink
urlLink Another sunset picture with some different trees. urlLink
urlLink The sky at sunset and a tree by my house. urlLink

urlLink I'm not gonna try to make this picture classier than it is. I took this in my backyard. It's some black cherry Kool-Aid in a glass that says 'Southern Comfort' on it...just turned to the back. I chose this for this week's challenge "Cool" because it was really hot when I took it outside in the sun and the drink was very cool. Not cold yet though. urlLink
urlLink My grandma's dog, Lolita, through my cousin's "Diamond" (rather a diamond-looking thing made of glass) she got from the fair. urlLink
urlLink I thought my cousin's towl holder looked pretty cool urlLink
urlLink And another urlLink
urlLink View from the freeway on my way home from Oceanside. urlLink
urlLink I was at the beach in Carlsbad and I thought the view looked kinda pretty urlLink
urlLink Clouds above my head @ the beach urlLink
urlLink My cousin and Lolita on the bach urlLink
urlLink Another of the pier with a fisherman urlLink
urlLink Seagull by the pier urlLink
urlLink Time out at the beach urlLink
urlLink Yoga in the water urlLink

urlLink I chose a more current picture for this week's challenge than I had originally. I took this on tuesday at sunset down in Rosarito Mexico on the little private beach down there. My friend, Brittany, and I were the only people on the beach because everyone else had left. It was such a beautiful sunset! urlLink
urlLink My friend Brittany posing for the sunset. urlLink
urlLink The ocean from the rocks at the base of the broken pier. urlLink
urlLink This is the beach in Rosarito, Mexico by the broken pier with the sun and clouds reflecting off the wet sand. urlLink

urlLink This is a picture I took one night out of the car window when I was on my way back from Charley's (a fast food place...the best around...that serves burgers and fries, that is). I was tring to get the moon and the new freeway...and I guess it worked. It's an okay picture. urlLink
